Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cruzioseptin-1 (CZS-1; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, UCLL1c; XXA; 12 more AMPs?)
Sequence Information.Source: the splendid leaf frog,Cruziohyla calcarifer, South America

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 58.3% similarity toNigrocin-1-OA3.Activity: Active against E. coli (15.1 uM), S. aureus (3.8 uM), and C. albicans (3.8 uM).Parasites: T. cruzi Trypomastigotes (IC50 2.87 uM) or Amastigotes (IC50 16.72 uM), P. falciparum NF54 (IC50 31.16 uM) or TM90C2B (IC50 16.76 uM), L. Mexicana (IC50 0.54 uM) (Proa単o-Bola単os et al., 2024.Updated 7/2021; 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Proa単o-Bola単os C, Zhou M, Wang L, Coloma LA, Chen T, Shaw C.2016
Literature Information.Title: Peptidomic approach identifies cruzioseptins, a new family of potent antimicrobial peptides in the splendid leaf frog, Cruziohyla calcarifer.
